# Using the HUD Canvas

You can use the HUD Canvas component to create custom heads-up displays for your rooms!


## Setup

- In the hierarchy, create a new empty object and make it a prefab.

- Open the prefab, and add the Rec Room Object component to your Empty Object,

- Then, add a UI > Canvas object under your Empty Object. Make sure it’s set to `Screen Space - Overlay`.

- Then, add the Rec Room Studio HUD Canvas component to your Canvas.

- Delete the Graphic Raycaster component under your Canvas (keep it if you’re making a World Space UI, but if you keep it as a Screen Space Overlay, you’ll get an error asking you to delete this component when attempting to upload)

- For the HUD to look good on most platforms, the recommended settings for the Canvas Scaler component are the following:

![](data:image/png;base64,)

And boom! You can now start adding your HUD Elements to your canvas, and they will appear in-game on your screen.

:::tip 
If you do not know how to make a HUD in Unity, here are a ton of tutorials you can find online on how to design them  [(like here!)](https://youtu.be/QWOpMN-yESA?si=PmNjuyo21Iv9LHn7), and then you can add functionality using studio functions, which you can learn more about [here](https://rrstudio.pages.dev/docs/cv2instudio/studiofunctions)
:::

Now go out there and design your UIs
